content: little fisherman s beanie by viktória bach the little fisherman s beanie is a classic fisherman hat with a twist it is worked bottom up in 1x1 rib after a small hem after it is finished it can be worn with the hem folded up or left the hem downwards as a slouchy hat knitwear design little fisherman s beanie materials 50g drops flora 13 - jeansblue 25g drops brushed alpaca silk 25 - steel blue 2 thread of flora and 1 thread of brushed alpaca silk held together 5 5mm circular knitting needles 40cm 6mm circular knitting needles 40cm stitch markers tapestry needle abbreviations gauge k knit 12 sts and 22 row = 10cm in 1x1 rib stitch p purl 6mm needles st s stitch es k2tog knit 2 together ssk slip slip knit stm stitch marker #littlefishermansbeanie #littlefishermansbeanie hem 2 thread of flora and 1 thread of brushed alpaca silk held together cast on 60 sts with any method you like i recommend long tail cast on with 5 5mm needles put a stitch marker on the beginning of the row knit 8 row now fold these 8 row so purl stitches would stay inside you have the cast-on edge and the latest row side by side with 6mm needles knit together one stitch from the cast-on edge with one stitch from the latest row then purl together one stitch from the cast-on edge with one stitch from the latest row - starting the 1x1 rib body knit in rib until the garment is 17 cm long - if you prefer a bigger hem knit 5 more cm in rib sts crown now starts the crown - from here knit stockinette sts knit 7 sts place a stm knit 1 st place a stm >> knit 14 sts place a stm knit 1 st place a stm >> repeat 2 more times now the beanie divided into 4 parts decrease in every second row with the following method ssk before stm knit 1 k2tog after stm when you have decreased to 14 sts knit one more row then k2tog the com- plete next row - 7 sts on the needle cut the yarn leave a long tail pull it through the remaining sts tighten properly and weave in at the wrong side weave in the ends and block as desired #littlefishermansbeanie
